BUTTON_MAIN.DESCRIPTION: Click here to see everything you can do with your document, including saving, printing or sharing it with others

ELEMENT.TEXT: Save a copy of the document

ELEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Save the document in the default file format.
Save the document as a template that can be used to format future documents.
Save a copy of the document that is fully compatible with Word 97-2003.

ELEMENT.TOOLTIP: Find add-ins for other file formats
ELEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Learn about add-ins to save to other formats such as PDF or XPS.
Open the Save As dialog box to select from all possible file types.
Select a printer, number of copies, and other printing options before printing.
Select a printer, number of copies, and other printing options before printing.
Send the document directly to the default printer without making changes.
Preview and make changes to pages before printing.
View and edit document properties, such as Title, Author, and Keywords.
Check the document for hidden metadata or personal information.
Increase the security of the document by adding encryption.
Ensure the integrity of the document by adding an invisible digital signature.
Let readers know the document is final and make it read-only.
Check for features not supported by earlier versions of Word.

ELEMENT.TEXT: Send a copy of the document to other people

ELEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Send a copy of the document in an e-mail message as an attachment.
Use an Internet fax service to fax the document.

ELEMENT.TEXT: Distribute the document to other people

ELEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Create a new blog post with the content of the document..
Share the document by saving it to a document management server.
Create a new site for the document and keep the local copy synchronized.
Display program information, version number and copyright

BUTTON_LAUNCH.DESCRIPTION: Show the Office Clipboard task pane.

ELEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Paste the contents of the Clipboard.
Cut the selection from the document and put it on the Clipboard.
Copy the selection and put it on the Clipboard.
Copy formatting from one place and applying to another.
Clear all the formatting from the selection, leaving only the plain text.
Draw a line through the middle of the selected text.
Create the small letters below the text baseline.
Create the small letters above the line of text.
Change all the selected text to UPPERCASE, lowercase, or other common capitalizations.
Make text look like it was marked with a highlighter pen.
Decrease the indent level of the paragraph.
Increase the indent level of the paragraph.
Alphabetize the selected text or sort numerical data.
Show paragraph marks and other hidden formatting symbols.
Align text to both the left and right margins, adding extra space between words as necessary.
Change the spacing between lines of text.
Color the background behind the selected text or paragraph.
Draw the borders of a table.
Show or hide the gridlines within the table.
Format titles, quotes, and other text using this gallery of styles.

ELEMENT.TEXT: Save Selection as a New &Quick Style...

ELEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Change the set of styles, colors, and fonts used in this document.
Navigate to a specific place in the document
Replace specific text with different text
Select text or objects in the document.
Change to the selection cursor so that you can select and move ink and other objects in the document.
Standard ribbon and commands. Optimized for use with mouse.
More space between commands. Optimized for use with touch.
Draw the borders of a table.
Show or hide the gridlines within the table.
Change to the selection cursor so that you can select and move ink and other objects in the document.

ELEMENT.DESCRIPTION: Save Selection to Cover Page Gallery...
Draw the borders of a table.
Insert ready-made shapes, such as rectangles and circles, arrows, lines, flowchart symbols and more
